alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Cumberland; Sagadahoc; York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 1:25PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwest Maine, including the following counties, in south central Maine, Sagadahoc. In southwest Maine, Androscoggin, Cumberland and York. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 122 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of moderate to heavy rainfall moving over the Interstate 95 corridor in southern Maine. This in combination with earlier rainfall could result in minor flooding, especially in poor drainage areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Portland, Lewiston, South Portland, Auburn, Biddeford, Brunswick, Westbrook, Alfred, Sanford, and Topsham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
